title: Dynamic queue has fucked up matchmaking balance.
body: I don't know what the hell is going on, but I have yet to win a single game in over two weeks.  This isn't the first time this has happened this season.  I don't know about you, but I don't like getting shit-stomped for 15 games in a row.  Last season, when something like that happened, MMR was recalculated, and I'd get a much better skill matchup.  Now, because of dynamic queue, I'm constantly getting stuck with premades, so something like that is impossible to implement.  So here I am, going to continue to lose to premades, without any hope of possibly winning.  This is beyond stupid.  Even if I wasn't getting matched with premades, my MMR isn't properly recalculating.  I'm still getting stuck playing against players much better than me.  This is goddamn infuriating.  This is why I took a break, and it looks like it's going to be for good now, since I can't seem to get a single fair matchup in over 25 games.

replies.body: Oh look another thread blaming all of their misfortunes on something that isn't actually the cause of their misfortunes. This shit is the new "elo hell". Stop dude. Just fucking stop.

I was Diamond for Seasons 3, 4, and 5, and I spent a lot of time in Diamond 1 in each of those Seasons. I was almost Challenger in Season 3 in fact.

This one, with Dynamic Queue, I made it to Diamond 4 in the beginning of the season but eventually got demoted to Plat 1 and am now in Plat 2, games are almost impossible to win. It's stupid. There are *way* too many clearly boosted players and the premades are hellish to deal with. I don't even play Ranked anymore because of it.

This Season is cancer not only because of the balancing (which is at an all time low) but because of Dynamic Queue. Even if you don't get placed vs premades (which in this elo you do a huge amount of the time, especially boosters) you have to deal with having boosted players on your team. And even then when the boosted players are on the other team, you won not because of your skill but as a result of a boosted player who decided to play solo. It is ridiculous. And with all the stupidity, toxicity is at an all time high which results in more tilt, more rage, and an overall far worse experience. It's not even remotely fun. Beating your head against the wall for 30 minutes straight loses you less brain cells than playing Ranked this season does.
It's possible you're like Oddone that the game is just getting more difficult and the players more talented, and you're not as invested at a level above your peers, as you once were.

From what I've seen, I  think in Oddone's case just from watching him since season 2 is that he's just done with League mentally.  Look back on his stream highlights from the early seasons and now and he's just not having fun anymore and streaming just because it gets the most views - otherwise he'd probably be a variety streamer.  It's ironic though that as much as he claims to hate the previous tank metas, he seemed to have the most fun during those times.

I'm not even talking about ranked.  I'm getting the exact same shit in normal matches (kinda the point of the thread). Normals have been like this forever..has nothing to do with dynamic que.

The way normals works is that it takes in a hidden MMR. I get paired with diamonds and plats a lot in normals, too.

But the difference here is that na.op.gg calculated my MMR to be BELOW the average one.
If I'm "below average", why am I placed with gold and plats? If it was low gold, maybe it is because they have low MMR, but then they'd be paired with high MMR silvers, not low MMR silvers. And plats, no matter what, should not be in a game along with silvers.

na.op.gg is both unofficial, (using an arbitrary system they created thats not linked to league matchmaking at all), and unreliable (as in, you can refresh the page without playing any games and get different results for your MMR)
It only calculates out of your most recent games played too.
Silver-plat really isnt a big difference if you're playing well. Silver-gold less so.

The difference between silver and plat is the difference between a challenger and a gold, or maybe even a plat.

It's a pretty huge gap.

Only talking rank-wise, it is the same distance, but the skill difference that separates a challenger from a gold is much much greater than silver and plat.

I've had similar streaks in every season I've played. Since s2. Lost 21 in a row once. I've lost ~8 in a row this season.

It happens.

I'm not saying it's never happened, but it hasn't been as drastic as this.  I'm sure you haven't had that 21 game lose streak more than once.  I've had these huge loss tilts twice in a row, where I'd go from winning and losing some, to just getting shit stomped for 15 straight games.  Then I'd win a game, then lose another 15.  That NEVER happened in previous seasons.  I've had losing streaks, sure, but they were never this drastic.

I lost a bunch in S3 cuz it was my first season and I was a MOBA noob.  I had a couple of small lose streaks in S4, but then I switched roles to keep things fresh and that helped.  S5 I had one lose streak and the rest were normally balanced (besides when Sion got reworked and Cinderhulk became a thing, I fucking REKT).  This season not only are my losing streaks twice as long as they were before, I had more than one or two.  And I'm talking about this week, not the entire season.  Random chance does not work like this.  This is a huge red flag that something is wrong with the system.

I've found the games to be more normalized and fair as an average than seasons past.

Personally, I think people are remembering too little about how bad ranked has always been. 

And let's not forget that the community improves alongside you. If you're not keeping up, you're left behind. Just look at Oddone as a perfect example. 

And, actually, I've had 8+ win/loss streaks multiple times in every season. I've only had one (so far) this season. This season I also got to my promos 8 times in a row (lost them everytime). But, kept at it, and kept climbing.

Side note: I've played 95% of my games solo.

Side note 2: I ended last season G5 as a support main. Felt myself very, very frustrated by matchmaking. I still think it's horrible and has a long way to go. I truly believe they should look more carefully at far more information than w/l to identify lp gains for a particular game. For example, a win nets you on average 20 lp, but +/- 10 lp depending upon how you performed within the contexts of the win as compared to similar contexts across the entire server and specific to your rank. It's not an easy problem, but they could do a lot. A whole lot. 

However, DQ is not the issue. If anything, considering the natural improvement new champ select has provided to fairness, DQ is a wash with previous seasons (if not better) overall.
